noun.description: The dried flower bud of a tropical tree, used as a pungent aromatic spice.
The Indonesian tree from which cloves are obtained.
A clove-scented pink which is the original type from which the carnation and other double pinks have been bred.

origin: Old English clufu, of Germanic origin, corresponding to the first element of German Knoblauch (altered from Old High German klovolouh), and the base of cleave.
